title: Framework
lead: Three pillars, a weekly training loop, and audit-ready outputs. Build an operating system for repeatable execution.

loop.lead: A fixed cadence turns ideas into outputs: input → break down → execute → review → iterate.

s1.v: Collect context: regime, narrative, locations, risk environment.

s2.v: Write a clean claim: force, location, and falsification.

s3.v: Run the gate, size by risk, and log decisions.

s4.v: Audit behavior: violations, exits, and evidence quality.

s5.v: Change one variable and re-run the loop next week.

audit.lead: A scorecard makes the process reviewable: consistency, risk, review quality, and stable perception.

a1.title: Consistency
a1.desc: Do gates, risk, and exits look the same across trades?

a2.title: Risk control
a2.desc: Is risk per trade consistent—and reduced when the environment changes?

a3.title: Review quality
a3.desc: Do you produce written reviews with corrective actions?

a4.title: Perception stability
a4.desc: Can you explain different markets with one framework under stress?
